Extract closing issue numbers from commit messages

Source: R/QCMergeLocal.R
ExtractGHClosingIssues.Rd

Extract closing issue numbers from commit messages

Usage

ExtractGHClosingIssues(
  chrCommitMessages,
  chrKeywords = c("close", "closes", "closed", "fix", "fixes", "fixed", "resolve",
    "resolves", "resolved"),
  strOwner = gh::gh_tree_remote()[["username"]],
  strRepo = gh::gh_tree_remote()[["repo"]]
)

Arguments

chrKeywords

(character) Keywords to search for just before issue numbers in commit messages. Defaults to the GitHub issue-linking keywords

strOwner

(length-1 character) GitHub username or organization name.

strRepo

(length-1 character) GitHub repository name.

Value

An integer vector of issue numbers found in chrCommitMessages that will be closed according to GitHub's keywords for linking issues to pull requests.

On this page
